logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class models a game itself. It is responsible for tracking the pieces and internally contains a board. It is also responsible for setting up a game and any AI that may be needed.
    Author:
    Andrei Letavin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Piece> _blackPieces
      The list or Black's pieces
      protected int _currentTurn
      Value for the which player is currently supposed to play, starts as RED_SIDE
      protected GameBoard _gameBoard
      The GameBoard object in use by this Game
      protected int _gameMode
      Value for the game mode, default value is BOTH_SIDES
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Piece> _graveYard
      The list of pieces that have been captured during the game
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Piece> _redPieces
      The list of Red's pieces

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Builds a default game as defined by initBoard and initPieces.
      Game(GameBoard gameBoard)
      Builds a game using the passed in GameBoard.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Builds a default game as defined by initBoard and initPieces.

      • Game

        public Game(GameBoard gameBoard)
        Builds a game using the passed in GameBoard. This method is NOT recommended.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - The game board used internally.

    • Method Detail

      • initPieces

        public void initPieces()
        Clears all pieces from the board and places them in their starting positions. This method assumes a standard board (9 x 7)

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        Sets up the _gameBoard field to be a standard Jungle board.

      • move

        public void move(int row,
                 int column,
                 int newRow,
                 int newColumn)
        Given a starting row and column and an ending row and column (called newRow and newColumn), this method moves the piece found at the starting position if possible.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newRow - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newColumn - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - If an invalid move is purposed, an exception is thrown of type InvalidMoveException.

      • getNextMoveRed

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getNextMoveRed()
        Returns the move the computer would make as red.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList<Tile> containing the starting move an ending move tiles the computer chose as its move as red.

      • getNextMoveBlack

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getNextMoveBlack()
        Returns the move the computer would make as black.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList<Tile> containing the starting move an ending move tiles the computer chose as its move as black.

      • getNextMove

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getNextMove(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> movesOfSide)
        Returns the move the computer would make as black.
        Parameters:
        movesOfSide - The set of pieces the computer can play with.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList<Tile> containing the starting move an ending move tiles the computer chose as its move. If there is no move, null is returned.

      • getGameBoard

        public GameBoard getGameBoard()
        Allows the _gameBoard field to be examined.
        Returns:
        the _gameBoard field used internally to store the game board.

      • setGameBoard

        public void setGameBoard(GameBoard gameBoard)
        This method allows the _gameBoard field that is used to store the game board internally, to be set. Use of thus method is not encouraged.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - the value _gameBoard should be set to.

      • whoWon

        public int whoWon()
        Determines who won or lost at any point during the game.
        Returns:
        An int representing the winner at any point. This int will follow the values outlined in the ConstantValues class.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.io.File placeToSaveTo)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the current state of the game to a binary file for later reading.
        Parameters:
        placeToSaveTo - The file object containing the information about the file to save to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error during the operation.

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame(java.io.File placeToSaveTo)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads the state of a binary file.
        Parameters:
        placeToSaveTo - The file object containing the information about the file to load from.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If parsing of the saved game to a new Game object fails.
        java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error during the load operation.

      • getValidMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getValidMoves(int row,
                                               int column)
        Given a row and column containing a piece, all of the valid moves are returned in an ArrayList<Tile>. This is a wrapper of the same method found in GameBoard.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0)
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0)
        Returns:
        The all of the tiles the piece at the row and column parameters can move to.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int row,
                    int column)
        Returns the tile at the given row and column indexes.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0)
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0)
        Returns:
        The Tile at the given indexes.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int row,
                       int column,
                       int newRow,
                       int newColumn)
        Given a starting row and column and an ending row and column (called newRow and newColumn), this method determines if the move is possible.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        column - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newRow - The row index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        newColumn - The column index in the game board (starts at 0) for starting position.
        Returns:
        true if the move can be made, false otherwise.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Run a new game, using the given arguments. This appears to be a default testing implementation.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error during the operation.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If there is a problem with deserialization of the Game object.

      • setGameMode

        public void setGameMode(int gameMode)
        Sets the game mode.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - The game mode to be used inside the game.

      • getGameMode

        public int getGameMode()
        Returns the game mode.
        Returns:
        The current game mode.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
